intro: Epitrachys vulgaris, commonly known as the common epitrachys, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Epitrachys vulgaris is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich habitats.
